sentences.english: Wherever the peasant associations are powerful, there is not a trace of banditry.
sentences.chinese: 什么盗匪，在农会势盛地方，连影子都不见了。

sentences.english: Viceroys who were often no better than bandits.
sentences.chinese: 往往和盗匪无甚差别的总督大人们。

sentences.english: Having been warned about the bandits, she left her valuables at home.
sentences.chinese: 有人警告她有盗匪，她把贵重物品都留在家里。

sentences.english: They themselves are energetically prohibiting gambling and suppressing banditry .
sentences.chinese: 他们自己在那里努力禁牌赌，清盗匪。

sentences.english: The bandits withdrew to their mountain fastness for the winter.
sentences.chinese: 盗匪们撤回到他们的山寨中准备过冬。

sentences.english: I’m so mean I’ve got a burglar alarm on my dustbin.
sentences.chinese: 我非常吝啬，在我家垃圾箱里安装了个盗匪警报器。

sentences.english: Many lives were destroyed by robbers. But none left the village.
sentences.chinese: 许多人都死在盗匪的手下，但无人离村。

sentences.english: The robbers struck the bank in broad daylight!
sentences.chinese: 盗匪在光天化日之下，洗劫银行。

sentences.english: Im afraid your parrot has seen too many films about stealing.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕你们的鹦鹉看的盗匪片太多了。

sentences.english: The government army launched an offensive against the bandits mountain fastness, which was located on the mountaintop.
sentences.chinese: 官军向位于山顶的盗匪山寨发动了进攻。

sentences.english: The local military power also developed on account of bandit problems at that time.
sentences.chinese: 又因为盗匪问题，地方团练反而得以发展。

definition: horse thief/(old) group of horse-mounted bandits
to break into a house for robbery (idiom)
